headline: Honey Baked Chicken II
description: Curried honey mustard imparts a golden hue to tender baked chicken.

video.description: Honey, mustard, and curry create a simple, 5-star baked chicken that's ready in no time.
video.name: Honey Baked Chicken II

name: Honey Baked Chicken II
recipeIngredient: 1 (3 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Place chicken pieces in a shallow baking pan, skin side up. Combine the melted butter or margarine, honey, mustard, salt and curry powder and pour the mixture over the chicken. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 1/4 hours (75 minutes), basting every 15 minutes with pan drippings, until the chicken is nicely browned and tender and the juices run clear.

review.reviewBody: Great!!
I used this on a batch of chicken legs. It was delicious. I did not make any changes to the recipe.
Delicious!! My son allergic to just about and this is a fantastic meal I can make for him and the rest of the family that we all enjoy. Definitely becoming a family favorite.
It's kinda crazy how good this is given the ingredients. Loved it!
Make this with yellow rice, it’s amazing!
Very good and easy to prepare. I didn’t have curry powder so replaced it with chili powder. It turned out yummy! A keeper!
Used blackened spice instead of curry it was great.
The honey glaze was out of this world!
I must have missed something, it didn't have the same flavor as described. I ended up putting BBQ sauce on it. Well, I tried.
I used chicken thighs so had to decrease time. chicken just fell apart was delicious
I really enjoyed the ease of preparing this and then it tasted as good as I hoped. I will make it again
This is my go-to quick meal.
Yum!
it was very good but when using just chicken thighs there was a lot of grease so the butter could be cut down much more depending on the pieces of chicken you are using. Would make this again.

Got great feedback from everyone here who ate it. Very easy recipe, and extremely delicious. I also cut back on the butter, covered w foil 40m and baked uncovered for another 30m. Goes great w rice(drizzle some sauce over the rice!) and steamed veggies. Next time I'll add 1 more tsp of curry powder for more spiciness.
This was very tasty. I marinated it and covered with foil for the first 30 minutes of baking like the others suggested. Next time less butter and more curry. Will definitely make it again.
I needed to use less butter but otherwise awesome!
LOVE IT! Easy to make and very delicious!
So tasty! Cut down the amount of butter and added crushed red pepper flakes. It was a hit! Will definitely make again.
I used chicken thighs only in this one, marinaded for 30 min in a little soy sauce and orange juice. I only basted twice :( but still came out great.
I did not have any curry, so I left it out. The family still thought the chicken was great.
Loved this recipe! I only omitted the salt.
I loved it. So did the kids! Easy to prepare. Didnt like basing it every 15 minutes so much but it was worth it!

Baked this chicken with all the ingredients listed, using suggestions from other users: I cut the butter in 1/2, marinated the skinless chicken breasts for 3 hours, and covered the baking dish with foil for the first half of the bake time. One large chicken breast took 50 minutes. The meat was moist and very tender. Will definitely be making this again!
Super easy and super yummy
Absolutely delicious. Can't wait to make it again. I used boneless, skinless chicken thighs and added two gloves of garlic. I highly recommend it.

Really good recipe! The chicken was very juicy. Unfortunately, I didn't have any curry (I don't know how this happened - I'm sure it was in my spice rack). The honey, mustard and butter was still a good combination. I'm eager to try it again with the curry.

Really good recipe! The chicken was very juicy. Unfortunately, I didn't have any curry (I don't know how this happened - I'm sure it was in my spice rack). The honey, mustard and butter was still a good combination. I'm eager to try it again with the curry.
Followed recommendations and used 1/2 the butter., 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp garlic salt, 1.5 tsp garam masala, and zest some fresh ginger. Otherwise the same.
Delicious! Used skinless, boneless breasts. I will try it with half butter next time.
This was good for a change, but not my favorite.
Will definitely make it again; used less honey (1/3 cup).......delicious!
used half the butter as suggested

A winner!! I used a whole, 4-lb. cut-up Kosher chicken, and the full amount of butter (may use less next time :)). Instead of the full amounts of honey and mustard, I used lesser amounts of Trader Joe's "Honey Pale Ale Mustard" and Trader Joe's Raw Organic Honey. I DID cover the chicken for the first 30 mins., (as others had recommended); then uncovered and basted every 15 mins. for the remainder of time. Even tho' the inside temp. of the chicken was around 185ºF when done, the chicken was moist & juicy (even the breast!) It was DELICIOUS, and the sauce was great over rice!

Made this with minor changes: only 2T of butter and bumped the curry powder up to 2t. Started skin side down @ 375, covered the dish in foil. Removed the foil after 30min and turned the thighs skin up, basting every 10min for 30 more minutes.

Removed the chicken to a dish and transferred the sauce to a saucepan, skimming the fat. Punched up the sauce with honey and mustard, thickened with cornstarch slurry, making a nice gravy. Served with whole roast garlic cloves on the side.
Loved this recipe. Made it exactly as directed. Will definitely make this again.
it was delicious. i loved it

This is really delicious. I used half the amount of butter like some suggested and even that was a bit too much, I might omit it completely next time tbh. Just to see what would happen.
That said, I do plan to make it again, I’ll leave it to marinade too.

I have made this several times, and agree that 1/4 cup butter is plenty. Just one note: I am a salt lover, but some curry powders have a lot of salt already! I mix it all together without any salt first, and then taste it. One of the Madras Curry powders I have needs no salt added, but I need to use 2 tsp. of the powder for flavor. I usually use skinless boneless cutlets, and cover it for 30 minutes, and uncover for 20. thicken up the sauce a bit and put it over rice. I usually serve it with a green vegetable.

This was delicious! I didn’t have any curry on hand so I used ground cumin. Also made with chicken breasts and covered with foil for the first 40 minutes. I also reduced butter and added garlic powder, crushed red pepper and kickin’ Chicken seasoning. I cut the chicken into bite--sized pieces and gave a good stir every 10 mts. After removing foil. Will make again—served with seasoned angel hair pasta and steamed vegetables.
What a wonderful flavor!
Very good. The only change I made was to use a different kind of musrtard (Guilden's) .
I used this recipe with chicken thighs and other than the skins coming out rubbery, the taste was great!!
This was an excellent flavor combination. I made baby potatoes and carrots with the chicken and it was a hit! I will definitely make this again.

This is an awesome recipe! I used boneless chicken breasts and thighs. As suggested by other reviews, I decreased butter to 1/4 C, & increased curry. I also used only 1/4 C honey since I'm trying to reduce my sugar intake. So it was equal amounts of butter, honey and mustard. A huge hit! A keeper!
I used chicken thighs instead and loved it.

Excellent dish! I added a few of the ideas in the comments but also used boneless & skinless chicken breasts. Poked holes as suggested but didn't marinate long. Added extra teaspoon of curry powder, 1/2 teaspoon of cumin and 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder. Cooked in Pyrex baking dish with a lid for 30 minutes, then removed lid and cooked an additional 30 minutes. I'd added about 1/8 cup of water to the spices so the chicken was covered and basting wasn't necessary. Chicken was delightful and tender. Definitely a repeat recipe.
This was really good. I made it exactly to recipe (which I don't usually do). Make sure you spoon the glaze over the chicken every 15 minutes like instructed. It makes a big difference.
This was amazing! Really, really enjoyed it. Will make again. Made it with a side of brown rice and roasted asparagus.
A
Wonderful recipe, although I added more spices in addition to the curry for flavor: cumin, turmeric, cayenne pepper and ginger.
Not great.

I took this recipe to another level. I used a rotisserie chicken. A nice big juicy one from a popular warehouse store. I broke it down into eight pieces. I made the sauce with the only changes being decreased butter and adding a pinch of cayenne pepper. I used a 9x 13 pan lined with foil. The preheated oven was at 350. I covered the pan with foil and cooked 30 min. I increased the temp to 400, removed the foil and cooked another 30 min. basting twice.
The chicken skin caramelized and the sauce thickened.
Great recipe, good flavor and so easy.
I added habanero sauce and kicked it up a few notches and came out great.
I don't know if I made as good as the rest but my family liked it. Might hit this up again
Very tasty and visually pleasing. I did cover it with foil for the first 30 minutes. The chicken came out juicy and "fall of the bone" tender.

The only changes I made were using 1/4 C butter instead of 1/2 C and I omitted the salt. We will be making this again! Very simple. If you baste it every 15 min per the instructions, there is no need to cover it with tin foil. My house also smells amazing now! I didn't get a chance to take a picture, we ate it all up---looked just like the main recipe though!

Really easy to make and delicious. I did not use curry seasoning because I don't like the flavor. I used 1/4 cup of butter, 1/4 cup of honey, and 1/4 cup of Dijon mustard as other reviewers suggested. I also laid the chicken on top of sliced yellow onions. I basted the chicken every fifteen minutes. I started the chicken skin side down and covered. After the first fifteen minutes, I turned the chicken over and then basted every fifteen minutes. I also sliced a russet potato and laid the thick slices on the baking sheet. I continued basting the chicken and potatoes every fifteen minutes. The result is an absolutely delicious one-pan meal. Keep an eye on it towards the end of cooking time because the honey starts to carmelize and could burn. My chicken was a little over done and looked a little like barbecue but it was honesty yummy. I would serve this to company in a minute, especially because it's inexpressive and SO EASY to prépare. Yummy, yummy, yummy! Next time I'll make a bigger tray so that I have plenty of leftovers.

This is pretty good. I followed the reviews and cut he butter in half. I also covered with tin foil for 30 mins and then the remaining I uncovered and would baste every little while after. Very tender and juicy.
i do agree with the other reviewers that you can half the butter, but the flavor is delicious! I will definitely make this again.

My husband liked it. I thought it was like chicken put in watery barbecue sauce. If I were to make it again, I’d get rid of the butter altogether and increase the spice level. I’d also marinate the chicken in advance.

I do think the sauce would be good for carrots.
Delicious!

Really great recipe! I didn’t have enough mustard so I added what I had left and used a tiny bit of balsamic vinegar to make up for it- and it tasted fantastic. I used boneless chicken thighs and I cooked for an hour basting every 15 minutes. I sprinkled rosemary on top after 30 minutes. My kids loved it. I served it with white rice- sour cream and onion red potatoes in the steam bag and broccoli, everyone really loved it and we used the gravy on our rice. Thanks for the good meal to add to my rotation
My family loved it and I will definitely make it again. I followed the recipe exactly.
This was a great recipe! Enjoyed it very much!
It wasn't terrible, but I probably won't make again. Finished my meal and still couldn't decide if I liked it. The flavors were just an odd combo for me.
I didn’t really like the flavor and thought I would love it

First time fixing this recipe, will not be the last. I baked it at 325 in my convection oven, think next time may try 300. I went with the full recommended cooking time. The skin was more dark, internal temperature was 205, but the meat was just wonderful, falling off the bone. The dark skin had a nutty cashew flavor, but was a little chewy. I did season with salt and pepper before the first basting. 
Bottom line is this dish is wonderful!

I would give this four stars but my boyfriend loved it and practically licked his plate clean. Next time I make it, I’m going to use boneless chicken thighs and I will probably like it more. The flavor was good and it was really easy to make...a little on the greasy side with all the butter. I halved it and still thought it was a little much. Overall, good and I will definitely make again.

I prepared the recipe exactly as written. I was really excited to try this recipe. It was easy to prepare, the chicken looked fantastic, was moist and juicy. Unfortunately, the flavor was just OK, very disappointing. 
I still give it 4 stars due to ease of preparation, sticky glaze and the moist, juicy chicken. I just really wish this had more flavor.
The flavor was good, but WHAT A MESS! I put parchment paper in the pan first - but the juices seem to find their way under and get burnt in the pan. Too much butter indeed. ( Like some others said)
Used 1/4 cup butter, thickened the gravy on the stove and served over rice.

For me the cooking time seemed too long. My chicken thighs were hard as cardboard. If I do this recipe again I would alter the amount of butter ( as per other reviewers) and the cooking time. It wasn't a hit at my party but maybe next time.

My stepson dislikes chicken but he ate this and said Soo good nice and sticky yippee I found a chicken he can enjoy thank you

,
This is my daughter’s favorite dish. Quick, easy and oh so delicious!

I have made this several times and when I followed the recipe exactly, it was delicious. However, I have modified the recipe slightly by cutting the butter in 1/2 and adding a can of coconut milk. It makes more gravy and it's not as fatty.

I made this with bone in thighs and it was really, really good ( my husband ate 3 pieces). The only thing I did different is added fresh garlic and doubled the recipe for the sauce. I coated the chicken with 1/2 the sauce and baked covered for 45 min, then brushed on the other 1/2 every 10 min until cooked and the tops were crispy. Will for sure make this again!

This was really good. I read a bunch of reviews and changed it up a tiny bit. First I used stone ground mustard, I only used 2 tbsp of margarine and I doubled the amount of curry powder amd salted and peppered the chicken before pouring the marinade on it. This smelled amazing and looked and tasted even better. I'm definitely adding this into my monthly rotation of recipes

I used a one pound chicken breast and cut it into thirds. I only cooked half the recipe with only 1/4 teaspoon of curry. Tasted alright. I baked a half hour covered with foil and a half hour uncovered. Chicken was moist and a little brown. I'll make this again.
Wow this chicken is GOOD! I followed the recipe exactly as written and it turned out perfect. So delicious! Will definitely be making this again
even though I accidentally doubled the mustard, and forgot to baste... it was so yummy... will definitely be making again!!!

Will use half the butter amount next time like the other reviews suggested. 
I made it on the stove top and it turned out great.
Very good. Thank you.
Just needed a little less butter

I have made this a couple of times. I use boneless skinless breasts, only because my family and I prefer those. I also add a teaspoon or two of chalula hot sauce and season the chicken with tony's Creole seasoning before adding the sauce. My family loves this recipe!

I wish I could give this recipe 100 stars!!! I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE this recipe! Using chicken thighs bone in are better then boneless chicken breasts.... The bones and dark meat really enhances the flavor. I do like to make more of the sauce to dip the chicken in or have it on the rice. I will even save the sauce and use it on another meal. I've never been a huge curry fan but this recipe uses it so well that I'm so glad I tried it. Yummm yummm yummm... I don't change anything to it. It's amazing just how it is!! Give it a try!
My grandmother used this same recipe. Its wonderful like a stir fry too. I double the sauce and use chopped up chicken breast. Served over rice it's a nice, simple warm dinner!
I made two changes. I didn't have curry powder so I took out the mustard and used a curry paste that I did have. Also, I put this on chicken wings. My husband really liked it.
I should have read the review and reduced the butter especially because my hubby is not a fan of curry so I substituted for soy sauce

This turned out surprisingly delicious! As suggested in reviews, I used 1/4 cup butter, 1 1/4 tsp curry powder and rest as is. Also added 1/2 tsp garlic powder. I used 4 thigh-leg quarters. Baked at 350F covered for 30 mins, turned the chicken and continued baking uncovered for another 30 mins. Turned again and then increased temp to 400F and baked for another 20 mins. There were a lot of oil so I separated the chicken from the sauce. Drained excess oil. Added some cornstarch (dissolved in water) and boiled til sauce thickened. Then poured sauce on top. Served with rice. Awesome! I will definitely make again.
This recipe is delicious. I only used 1/2 of the amount of butter listed in recipe.
Very good! Will make again. Made with 3 lbs of chicken but probably could have enough marinade/sauce for 3.5-4 lbs.
I halved the recipe and it still was enough to marinate 5 big chicken thighs. Also used 1/4 cup of butter and added in some garlic .
Wow! This was good, and very easy to make in a short amount of time. And I was really surprised that my 10-year-old liked it so much. This is a keeper - thank you.
4 Stars as I would have preferred a dryer mustard preparation.

I make this recipe OFTEN. I make it EXACTLY as recipe states with a 14 pack of chicken drumsticks. My picky husband says it is his favorite way that I make chicken and all the kids eat it ( which is a miracle...) Do not forget to baste-- it's important!
Excellent! cut butter in half. Upped curry. Added cayenne. Put thin slices of onion in pan then put chicken on top. Used skinless chicken thighs. Basted every 15 minutes. Took about 45 minutes.
This is an awesome dish!!! I make it all the time. It's one of my favorite things to make. Truly delish! I use boneless, skinless chicken thighs.

I also reduced the butter and I let the chicken marinade overnight. I used bone-in and skin on chicken thighs. I was not wowed. I will make this again with legs or breasts instead and see if this is better. The glaze needs something.
